awd_abstract_narration: This action will provide continued support to a group from                 Michigan State University consisting of three senior members,                   two post-docs, four graduate students and two technical                         associates working in elementary particle physics.  Later in                    the grant period the group is expected to complete a Fermilab                   fixed-target experiment (E706) testing the currently accepted                   theory of the strong interactions, quantum-chromo-dynamics.                     They will embark on a new program, "The Collider Detector                       Facility (CDF)", at Fermilab.  The E706 experimental program                    involves a continuation of the analysis of the data from its                    1989-88 run and preparation for two additional runs, the first                  to begin in early 1990.  Three graduate students are expected                   to receive their Ph.D degrees based on the analysis of the E706                 data.  The  CDF experimental program will phase-in as the E706                  results mature.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
